taxon_identification.other_info_on_name: [for Anreder, about whom nothing else is known]

bio:treatment.discussion: Anredera cordifolia (Tenore) Steenis has been shown to have anti-inflammatory, anti-ulcer, and liver-protective effects in rats (as Boussingaultia gracilis; Lin C. C. et al. 1994; Lin W. C. et al. 1995, 1996). Anredera vesicaria (Lamarck) Gaertner has been used in Mexico to treat broken bones and flesh wounds (as A. scandens; R. Mata 1993).

key_statement.description: Larger leaves proximal to inflorescence cordate at base; pedicel bracts basally connate, p er-sisting at apex of pedicel; sepals not winged in fruit; axillary tubers often produced
Larger leaves proximal to inflorescence tapering at base; pedicel bracts distinct, deciduous;sepals winged in fruit; without axillary tubers
